description: The SNMP trap that is generated when no valid Security
Association exists for a session.
-- address type %u Source %s Destination address type %u Destination %s
-- SPI %s.

event.Summary: Invalid security association for IPSec session; source: $v2, destination: $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BROCADE-IPSEC-MIB::brcdIPSecInvalidSANotification IPSEC-SPD-MIB::spdIPSourceType i 0 IPSEC-SPD-MIB::spdIPSourceAddress s EXAMPLE IPSEC-SPD-MIB::spdIPDestinationType i 0 IPSEC-SPD-MIB::spdIPDestinationAddress s EXAMPLE BROCADE-IPSEC-MIB::brcdIPSecSPIValue s EXAMPLE

triggered the notification.

Security Payload Packet. It's value will be displayed in
hex.
variables.name: BROCADE-IPSEC-MIB::brcdIPSecSPIValue

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when a packet offered to ESP
for processing appears to be an IP fragment, i.e., the OFFSET
field is non-zero or the MORE FRAGMENTS flag is set.
-- Address type %u Source %s Destination address type %u
-- Destination %s SPI %s.

event.Summary: Fragmented IPSec packet received by ESP; source: $v2, destination: $v4

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when there is an attempt to
transmit a packet that would result in Sequence Number
overflow.
-- with with SPI %s Source address type %u Source %s Destination
-- address type %u Destination %s.

event.Summary: Sequence number overflow on IPSec packet transmission; source: $v2, destination: $v4

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when maximum IKE peer limit
is reached a LP.
Indicates the Slot id of the LP.
variables.name: BROCADE-IPSEC-MIB::brcdIPSecSlotNumber

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when the system recovers from
the maximum IKE peer limit condition on a LP.
-- Condition on a LP %u.

event.Summary: IKE peer limit is below the maximum

description: Indicates the Slot id of the LP.
variables.name: BROCADE-IPSEC-MIB::brcdIPSecSlotNumber
